title: James Piotr Montague
text:
James Piotr Montague (born 28 July 1979) is a <a href="British%20people">British</a> <a href="writer">writer</a>.
After studying Politics at <a href="Exeter%20University">Exeter University</a>, Montague discovered a love for writing. His first book, "When Friday Comes: Football in the War Zone (Mainstream)", follows his travels across the <a href="Middle%20East">Middle East</a>, visiting some of the most difficult countries in that area and looking at the relationship between <a href="soccer">football</a> and politics. The book won him the Best New Writer Award at the 2009 <a href="British%20Sports%20Book%20Awards">British Sports Book Awards</a>, run by the <a href="National%20Sporting%20Club">National Sporting Club</a>. A heavily revised second edition, "When Friday Comes: Football, War & Revolution in the Middle East" was published in May 2013.
His second book, "Thirty One Nil: On The Road With Football's Outsiders, a World Cup Odyssey", was published by <a href="Bloomsbury%20Publishing">Bloomsbury</a> in May 2014. The book was named Football Book of the Year at the 2015 <a href="British%20Sports%20Book%20of%20the%20Year%20Awards">British Sports Book of the Year Awards</a>.
Montague's third book, "The Billionaires Club: The Unstoppable Rise of Football's Super-Rich Owners (Bloomsbury)", was published in August 2017. And his fourth, "1312: Among the Ultras, A Journey With the World’s Most Extreme Fans", was published in March 2020.
